attributes.content: Aluminium Company of Egypt (Egyptalum) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: In 1969, on the banks of the River Nile in southern Egypt , began the process of construction of one of the most important giant projects and announced the birth of the giant company Egyptalum at Nag' a Hammady , some 100 km , north form Luxor governorate which embracing a civilization of 7000 years on its sides.

body.value:
In 1969, on the banks of the River Nile in southern Egypt , began the process of construction of one of the most important giant projects and announced the birth of the giant company Egyptalum at Nag' a Hammady , some 100 km , north form Luxor governorate which embracing a civilization of 7000 years on its sides. 

The following several factors were taken into consideration when chosen Nag'a Hammady as the location of aluminum factory : The nearness of the site to the High Dam Power Transformers Station (500 kv) . Near The port of Safaga to receive alumina and green coal. Abundant manpower to start processing the site and preparing for civil and metal constructions. 

 

Neighboring community development through building schools , construction and paving of roads and extension of railway lines for the transportation of workers. Distribution of industrial projects in various governorates of the Republic for the purpose of urban expansion in the desert so as not to affect the patches of agricultural land . Development of a vital area of Upper Egypt through establishing a high-tech project in the middle of a barren desert . 

 

The development of a vital area of Upper Egypt and the vicinity of this edifice , hence , establishing of residential cities alongside the plant to provide every amenity like housing, set tree - lined avenues , hospitals , sports fields , schools , shops , a bank , a police station and post office . In 1975, the first spark was launched announcing the start of production and the rise of aluminum metal . It reached five lines in July 1983 and put info of the 6th line in October 1997. In April 2010, all production lines were rehabilitated and upgraded to pre-baked cells to reach 320,000 tons annually .

 

(Source: Company)

The development of a vital area of Upper Egypt and the vicinity of this edifice , hence , establishing of residential cities alongside the plant to provide every amenity like housing, set tree - lined avenues , hospitals , sports fields , schools , shops , a bank , a police station and post office . attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Eurus Energy Group has been engaged in the renewable energy generation business globally for more than 30 years, since the establishment of its wind power generation business in the United States in 1987.

body.value:
Eurus Energy Group has been engaged in the renewable energy generation business globally for more than 30 years, since the establishment of its wind power generation business in the United States in 1987.

 

Wind power generation requires a long-term business strategy, from the initial site evaluations and wind measurement surveys to the construction, and also including the operations and maintenance through the lifespan of projects. Eurus Energy is a company that is consistently engaged in the three phases of the business: project development, construction, and long-term operation of power plants.


Eurus Energy’s capability as a global business is made possible and supported by a joint-venture between Toyota Tsusho, a Japanese “sogo shosha” (general trading company), and Tokyo Electric Power Company.　
Toyota Tsusho, via its worldwide commercial relationship network, and Tokyo Electric Power Company, via its historical experience with power plant construction and operation technologies, both apply their respective advantages to support Eurus’ global efforts and pursuit of success.

 

Currently, Eurus Energy maintains operations in 15 countries, with a current concentration within the U.S., Europe, and Asia-Pacific regions.


In recent years, we have been expanding our business domain not only in the Northern Hemisphere but also in the Southern Hemisphere, while taking advantage of the global network that only Toyota Tsusho's general trading company can offer. We are aggressively expanding our business into new regions while leveraging our experience in existing markets and anticipating market trends.


The decentralization of our ownership of power generation facilities across the globe serves to mitigate environmental risks including those posed by climate change, as well as country-by-country economic risks, such as changes in energy policies and electricity pricing. With this in mind, Eurus is working to stabilize its overall corporate management and portfolio development by the diversification of business risks.

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: As the national-level financial institution for agricultural, fishery and forestry cooperatives in Japan, The Norinchukin Bank plays a major role in Japanese society as a contributor to the development of the nation's economy and as a supporter of the advancement of the agricultural, fisheries and forestry industries with facilitated finance for its members including Japan Agricultural Cooperatives (JA), Japan Fishery Cooperatives (JF) and Japan Forest owners’ Cooperatives (JForest).

body.value:
As the national-level financial institution for agricultural, fishery and forestry cooperatives in Japan, The Norinchukin Bank plays a major role in Japanese society as a contributor to the development of the nation's economy and as a supporter of the advancement of the agricultural, fisheries and forestry industries with facilitated finance for its members including Japan Agricultural Cooperatives (JA), Japan Fishery Cooperatives (JF) and Japan Forest owners’ Cooperatives (JForest).

With the stable funding base provided by capital from JA, JF, and JForest, as well as JA Bank and JF Marine Bank deposits from their individual members and customers, the Bank, to achieve its mission, lends funds to members, agricultural, fishery and forestry workers, and companies related to the agricultural, fisheries and forestry industries. The Bank also conducts various lending and investment activities in Japan and abroad, efficiently manages funds and stably returns profits to its members.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Infinity Power is the largest African pure play renewable energy provider. The joint venture between Egypt’s Infinity and Masdar targets power generation projects in Africa through renewable energy sources, namely solar and wind, as well as other technologies such as green hydrogen and water desalination. The company also develops complementary technologies such as battery storage and transmission grids.

body.value:
Infinity Power is the largest African pure play renewable energy provider. The joint venture between Egypt’s Infinity and Masdar targets power generation projects in Africa through renewable energy sources, namely solar and wind, as well as other technologies such as green hydrogen and water desalination. The company also develops complementary technologies such as battery storage and transmission grids. 

 

In this way, Infinity Power can provide answers to the challenges of energy supply and power insecurity across the African continent. Infinity Power has set an ambitious target of developing 10 GW of operational renewable energy across Africa by 2030, requiring a substantial $5 billion USD investment. This initiative aims to provide electricity to 12 million African homes by the end of the decade.

 

Infinity Power is committed to lighting up Africa and supporting the sustainable development of renewable energy across the continent, while creating opportunities for economic, educational and environmental benefits in local communities.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: Millennial Potash is listed on the TSX-V: MLP, OTCQB: MLPNF, and Frankfurt: X0D. The company has a history of fast-tracking projects, led by the same board and management team that have built and successfully exited multiple resource companies, including Millennial Lithium (TSXV: ML), Allana Potash (TSX: AAA), and Potash One (TSX: KCL).

body.value:
Millennial Potash is listed on the TSX-V: MLP, OTCQB: MLPNF, and Frankfurt: X0D. The company has a history of fast-tracking projects, led by the same board and management team that have built and successfully exited multiple resource companies, including Millennial Lithium (TSXV: ML), Allana Potash (TSX: AAA), and Potash One (TSX: KCL).

The company's flagship asset, the Banio Potash Project located in Gabon, West Africa, has all the characteristics to become a significant producer of potash. This previously explored resource is situated in a proven West Africa potash-bearing basin, within a stable mining and political jurisdiction in Gabon. With camp and infrastructure already on site, the resource is amenable to a low-cost solution mining method and is in proximity to the largest importing nations in the world - China, India, and Brazil. Additionally, the management team has a strong track record of delivering significant shareholder value.

Millennial is committed to using environmentally sustainable and responsible practices in its operations and has established partnerships with local communities to ensure its projects have a positive impact on the surrounding areas.

 

(Source: Company)

body.value:
Micon is a mining consultancy providing independent professional advice to mining companies, providers of capital, law firms and government agencies. Staffed by senior mineral industry consultants with extensive international experience in the fields of geology, mining engineering, metallurgy, processing, social and environmental management, market analysis and mineral economics, the firm is well qualified to carry out consulting assignments throughout the world. (Source: Company)

attributes.content: The preservation of biological diversity is currently a key issue for tomorrow's world.Any industrial project must be preceded by an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment, which analyzes the direct and indirect impacts of the project on the physical and biological natural environment, on the ecological balance and ecosystem services, as well as on the quality of life and the environment of the people living in the project's area of influence.

body.value:
The preservation of biological diversity is currently a key issue for tomorrow's world.

Any industrial project must be preceded by an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment, which analyzes the direct and indirect impacts of the project on the physical and biological natural environment, on the ecological balance and ecosystem services, as well as on the quality of life and the environment of the people living in the project's area of influence.

Our multidisciplinary team supports companies in the development of their environmental policy, in the identification and analysis of environmental aspects and impacts, and in the implementation of their sustainable development policy through a continuous improvement approach of the company's environmental performance.

 

Our partners, technical and scientific experts, allow us to tackle a wide range of projects, while respecting the highest international standards.

  • Diagnostics, audits, due diligence
  • Environmental and Social Impact Assessments (ESIA)
  • Elaboration and follow-up of Environmental and Social Management Plans (ESMP)
  • Environmental monitoring (physical and biological environments)
  • Biodiversity inventories (fauna and flora)
  • Biodiversity Action Plans
  • Payments for Ecosystem Services
  • Environmental management

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: The Government of Gabon is the executive authority responsible for the administration and governance of Gabon, a country located in Central Africa. It is tasked with overseeing national development, including economic policies, public services, and infrastructure projects. The government operates within a presidential system, with the President of Gabon serving as both the head of state and government. Key functions of the government include policy formulation, implementation of development programs, and ensuring the overall welfare and progress of the nation.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: China Overseas Engineering Group Co., Ltd (hereinafter referred to as COVEC or Company), located in Haidian District,Beijing, is a state-owned integrated enterprise with independent legal person status. The Company was initiated and founded by China National Complete Plant Export Corporation in 1987; it became a subsidary enterprise of the former Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation in October 1991, and was officially named as China National Overseas Engineering Corporation.

body.value:
China Overseas Engineering Group Co., Ltd (hereinafter referred to as COVEC or Company), located in Haidian District,Beijing, is a state-owned integrated enterprise with independent legal person status. The Company was initiated and founded by China National Complete Plant Export Corporation in 1987; it became a subsidary enterprise of the former Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation in October 1991, and was officially named as China National Overseas Engineering Corporation. The Company was incorporated into the former Working Committee for Central Enterprises in October 1998, and into the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council (SASAC) in 2003. Approved by the SASAC on December 19, 2003, the Company restructured strategically with China Railway Group Limited (hereinafter referred to as CREC) and became its subsidiary. In the year of 2020, CREC carried out major strategic reform for its overseas business development mechanism, with the pattern of “One-entity, Two-wings, and N-drives”. COVEC, taking the role of one wing, will shoulder the leading responsibility in promoting the development of overseas markets vigorously.

 

Since it was established more than 30 years ago, COVEC has undertaken over1,000 large and medium sized projects in nearly 100 countries, with a total contract value of USD 12.22 billion and a turnover of USD 8.584 billion, covering housing construction, roads, bridges, irrigation and water conservancy, photovoltaic power stations and other fields. Since 1990s，the Company has been consecutively listed in the ENR Top 225 International Contractors which has established an eminent reputation in the international project contracting markets. “COVEC” has been developed into a well-known international engineering contractor brand in some regional markets like Africa, South Pacific, Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe and others. The Company has won many awards including "National Advanced Enterprise In General Contracting of Construction Enterprise", "Market Development Award for Foreign Contracting Engineering Enterprises in China", "Best of Category Award for the Construction of Project Management System"; been rated as the Grade AAA Credit Rating Enterprise in the Foreign Contracting Engineering Industry, Foreign Labor Service Cooperation Industry and China Chamber of Commerce for Import and Export of Machinery and Electronic Products; and won the honorary title of "National Model Enterprise with Harmonious Labor Relations". In July 2019, Bheri Babai Diversion Multipurpose Project in Nepal undertaken by COVEC participated the ENR’s 7th Annual Global Best Projects Competition and was selected as the Award of Merit in Water category, which filled the blank of CREC in this award.

 

Being one of the earliest state-owned enterprises that is engaged in the international engineering contracting markets and the field of labor export in China, COVEC has the operating qualification certificate for foreign labor cooperation (labor service output) of the P.R.C., Grade A qualification for general contracting of construction projects issued by the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development of the People’s Republic of China, Grade A qualification for general contracting of railway engineering construction, Grade A qualification for general contracting of municipal public engineering construction and Grade A qualification for specialized contracting of the highway pavement engineering and Grade A qualification for specialized contracting of building decoration engineering issued by Beijing Municipal Commission of Housing and Urban-Rural Development.

 

On August 12, 2020, COVEC, completing reform and restructuring successfully, was officially inaugurated, setting a brand-new development vision and strategy. At present, the Company has established 9 overseas regional headquarters respectively in Northern South America, South Pacific, West Africa, East Africa, Central Africa, Central and Eastern Europe, Southwest Europe, Central and Western Asia and Nepal, covering 88 countries. COVEC will pursue the development vision of "advocating value creation, forging high-quality character", set up the operation concept of "big overseas", "large market" and "major projects", practice the development strategy of "Taking the leading responsibility of two-wing fly, Building the product structure of three propellers, Aggregating superior resources, and Driving Innovative development" to accelerate the pace to step into the fast lane of high-quality development. We sincerely invite people of all circles to work together for a higher and further prospects.

 

(Source: Company)

body.value:
COSCO Shipping Ports is one of the world’s leading port operators and a subsidiary of China COSCO Shipping Corporation, a global maritime giant. Headquartered in Hong Kong, COSCO Shipping Ports manages a diversified portfolio of container terminals across key global trade routes, including strategic locations in Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and the Americas. 

The company specializes in terminal investment, development, and operation, offering integrated logistics and port services to facilitate global cargo movement. With a strong emphasis on innovation, efficiency, and strategic partnerships, COSCO Shipping Ports plays a pivotal role in enhancing China’s Belt and Road Initiative and expanding international maritime connectivity.

attributes.content: (Also known as Sociedad Ecuatoguineana de Construccion)ECOCSA is a construction company that has been successfully operating in Equatorial Guinea since 2000. Today, with approximately 4,000 employees and more than 1,000 units of heavy construction machinery and transport vehicles, it is one of the most prominent players in the spectacular development of this Central African country's infrastructure.

body.value:
(Also known as Sociedad Ecuatoguineana de Construccion)

ECOCSA is a construction company that has been successfully operating in Equatorial Guinea since 2000. Today, with approximately 4,000 employees and more than 1,000 units of heavy construction machinery and transport vehicles, it is one of the most prominent players in the spectacular development of this Central African country's infrastructure.

Developing road engineering as its primary field of activity, the company has fully autonomously developed the entire production process, from the primary production of construction materials in quarries, crushers, asphalt and concrete plants, through their transformation and up to their application in the most complex infrastructure projects.

In addition to numerous infrastructure projects and factory works, our company has successfully completed more than 150 km of various land communication routes throughout the country.

As a testament to the application of high-quality principles and a highly responsible relationship with its clients in terms of quality and scheduled completion dates, the Government of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea awarded our company the contract to build a section of highway that represents the main axis of the national road network.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: (Also known as Société des Mines du Sénégal) Who are we ?Senegal created, through the law of November 6, 2020, a national mining company called the Société  des Mines du Sénégal (SOMISEN SA), the statutes of which are subject to approval by decree on December 23, 2020.This company takes its place alongside the Société des Mines de Fer du Sénégal Oriental (MIFERSO), from which it distinguishes itself by its vocation to intervene on all mineral resources in general and by its national scope.

body.value:
(Also known as Société des Mines du Sénégal)

 

Who are we ?
Senegal created, through the law of November 6, 2020, a national mining company called the Société  des Mines du Sénégal (SOMISEN SA), the statutes of which are subject to approval by decree on December 23, 2020.

This company takes its place alongside the Société des Mines de Fer du Sénégal Oriental (MIFERSO), from which it distinguishes itself by its vocation to intervene on all mineral resources in general and by its national scope.


The Senegal Mining Company (SOMISEN SA) has the following missions:

Management of State participation in mining operations;
The marketing of mining products returning to the State;
The holding, alone or in association, of mining titles;
The implementation of State decisions and guidelines regarding the strategy of these mining companies;
Participation in negotiations between the State and the companies in which it manages the State's holdings and any other company where this holding is envisaged;
The representation of the State, alongside technical and financial supervisory authorities, at shareholder meetings and within the management or supervisory bodies of these mining companies;
The examination of the economic and financial situation of the companies concerned, the main investment and financing programs, acquisition or disposal projects and any question submitted to the management and supervisory bodies of these mining companies;
Regular assessment of the value of the State's stake in these companies and the formulation of recommendations by the State shareholder on these subjects;
The development of strategies for the payment and valuation of State dividends in these mining companies;
The acquisition of stakes in companies relating to its corporate purpose.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.title: Senegal Sovereign Fund for Strategic Investments (FONSIS)

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Senegal Sovereign Fund for Strategic Investments (FONSIS) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: (Also known as Fonds Souverain d’Investissements Stratégiques) The Sovereign Fund for Strategic Investments (FONSIS) was  authorized for  creation by Law 2012-34 of December 31, 2012. FONSIS SA was created in July 2013, in the form of a private law public limited company governed by the Uniform Act governing commercial companies and economic interest groups of the Organization for the Harmonization of Business Law in Africa (OHADA).  The Sovereign Fund  began its activities in 2014.

body.value:
(Also known as Fonds Souverain d’Investissements Stratégiques)

 

The Sovereign Fund for Strategic Investments (FONSIS) was  authorized for  creation by Law 2012-34 of December 31, 2012. FONSIS SA was created in July 2013, in the form of a private law public limited company governed by the Uniform Act governing commercial companies and economic interest groups of the Organization for the Harmonization of Business Law in Africa (OHADA).  The Sovereign Fund  began its activities in 2014.

FONSIS adheres to the Santiago Principles, which set out the operating rules of the largest international sovereign wealth funds. FONSIS is a member of:

  • the International Forum of Sovereign Wealth Funds (IFSWF),
  • the African Sovereign Investors Forum (ASIF),
  • AVCA (African Private Equity and Venture Capital Association),
  • African Private Equity and Venture Capital Association and
  • One Planet Sovereign Funds (OPSWF) initiative, bringing together sovereign wealth funds for investments to accelerate the energy transition.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Southern African Power Pool (SAPP) was established in 1995 at the SADC summit in Kempton Park, South Africa, by signing an Inter-Governmental Memorandum of Understanding. It is governed by four agreements: the Inter-Governmental Memorandum of Understanding, the Inter-Utility Memorandum, the Agreement Between Operating Members, and the Operating Guidelines. The SAPP has twelve member countries and four working committees, including the Environmental, Markets, Operating, and Planning sub-committees.

body.value: The Southern African Power Pool (SAPP) was established in 1995 at the SADC summit in Kempton Park, South Africa, by signing an Inter-Governmental Memorandum of Understanding. It is governed by four agreements: the Inter-Governmental Memorandum of Understanding, the Inter-Utility Memorandum, the Agreement Between Operating Members, and the Operating Guidelines. The SAPP has twelve member countries and four working committees, including the Environmental, Markets, Operating, and Planning sub-committees. It coordinates planning and operation among member utilities and provides a forum for regional solutions to electric energy problems.

attributes.content: Electricity Generation Company (Malawi) Limited (EGENCO) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Electricity Generation Company (Malawi) Limited (EGENCO) is a limited liability company incorporated under the Companies Act (Cap. 46:03) of the Laws of Malawi on 7th September 2016. The company was established with the mandate of generating electricity in Malawi. The Company was formed following the unbundling of the Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited into two separate institutions; one for generating electricity (thus EGENCO) and another one for transmission and distribution (thus ESCOM).

body.value:
Electricity Generation Company (Malawi) Limited (EGENCO) is a limited liability company incorporated under the Companies Act (Cap. 46:03) of the Laws of Malawi on 7th September 2016. The company was established with the mandate of generating electricity in Malawi. The Company was formed following the unbundling of the Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited into two separate institutions; one for generating electricity (thus EGENCO) and another one for transmission and distribution (thus ESCOM).

EGENCO started its operations as a separate and independent company on January 1, 2017. Currently, EGENCO operates four hydro power stations namely: Nkula, Tedzani, Kapichira and Wovwe. The Company also operates thermal power plants in Lilongwe, Mzuzu and Mapanga, Blantyre. Overall, EGENCO has a total installed generation capacity of 441.95MW, with 390.55MW from hydro power plants and 51.4MW from standby diesel power plants.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd (Eskom) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Eskom is pivotal in South Africa's and the Southern African Development Community's energy sector, producing over 90% of the region's electricity from coal, nuclear, fuel, diesel, water, and wind. Integrated with the Southern African Power Pool (SAPP), Eskom ensures grid stability. The System Operator, soon ITSMO, manages real-time operations to maintain a stable 50Hz frequency by balancing supply and demand. Eskom handles generation, transmission, distribution, and retail, investing continuously in new power stations and infrastructure.

body.value: Eskom is pivotal in South Africa's and the Southern African Development Community's energy sector, producing over 90% of the region's electricity from coal, nuclear, fuel, diesel, water, and wind. Integrated with the Southern African Power Pool (SAPP), Eskom ensures grid stability. The System Operator, soon ITSMO, manages real-time operations to maintain a stable 50Hz frequency by balancing supply and demand. Eskom handles generation, transmission, distribution, and retail, investing continuously in new power stations and infrastructure. Divisions like Gx, Tx, and Dx provide essential support functions, while Eskom Rotek Industries offers specialized services like turbine and transformer repairs, construction, and transport, reinforcing Eskom's commitment to reliable electricity and regional economic development.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: China-Congo Bank for Africa (BSCA) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: (Also known as Banque Sino-Congolaise pour l'Afrique)

body.value:
(Also known as Banque Sino-Congolaise pour l'Afrique)

 

BSCA was born from the political will of Presidents Denis SASSOU-N'GUESSO and XI JIPING, expressed during the official visit of the Chinese President to Congo in March 2013. The first act to materialize this political will of the two Heads of State was the signing, on June 12, 2014, of the Beijing Protocol. The second act, which will mark the crowning moment, took place on July 1, 2015, through the opening of BSCA.Bank to the public. Since then, BSCA.Bank has quickly established itself in the Congolese banking landscape. 

 

(Source: Republic of Congo finance ministry)

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Trade and Development Bank | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Established in 1985, TDB (Trade and Development Bank) is an investment-grade African regional development finance institution with a mandate to finance and promote trade, regional economic integration, and sustainable development. With an asset base of USD 10 billion, the bank offers tailored bilateral and syndicated financial solutions across various sectors to sovereign, financial institution, and corporate clients, including SMEs in the region.

body.value:
Established in 1985, TDB (Trade and Development Bank) is an investment-grade African regional development finance institution with a mandate to finance and promote trade, regional economic integration, and sustainable development. With an asset base of USD 10 billion, the bank offers tailored bilateral and syndicated financial solutions across various sectors to sovereign, financial institution, and corporate clients, including SMEs in the region. These solutions include direct financing through senior and mezzanine debt, equity, guarantees, and export credit financing, as well as non-financial products such as advisory services, asset management, and agency services.

TDB's ability to consistently deliver development impact alongside attractive financial returns has established it as a trusted partner for intermediating global and regional capital into the areas it serves. The bank's innovative equity capital structure comprises 47 sovereign and institutional shareholders, including pension funds, insurance companies, sovereign wealth funds, and development finance institutions. TDB mobilizes debt funding from a wide range of sources, including multilateral and bilateral banks, commercial banks, and global investors, through capital market issuances, lines of credit, risk-sharing agreements, co-financing arrangements, and export credit financing.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of Health, Population, and Hospital Reform (Ministère de la Santé, de la Population et de la Réforme Hospitalière) is a key government body in Algeria responsible for overseeing public health policies, the management of healthcare services, and hospital reforms across the country.

body.value:
The Ministry of Health, Population, and Hospital Reform (Ministère de la Santé, de la Population et de la Réforme Hospitalière) is a key government body in Algeria responsible for overseeing public health policies, the management of healthcare services, and hospital reforms across the country. 

The ministry’s mandate includes improving the healthcare system, ensuring the accessibility and quality of health services, and managing public health programs. It plays a critical role in shaping healthcare policies, regulating hospitals, addressing population health needs, and implementing reforms to modernize healthcare facilities and practices throughout Algeria.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The West African Development Bank (BOAD) Banque Ouest Africaine de Développement operates with a primary focus on solidarity, as delineated in its Articles of Association and General Policy Statement. Its core objectives include promoting balanced development and fostering economic integration among member states of the West African Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU). BOAD prioritizes initiatives that address natural disadvantages and enhance economic cohesion within the region.

body.value: The West African Development Bank (BOAD) Banque Ouest Africaine de Développement operates with a primary focus on solidarity, as delineated in its Articles of Association and General Policy Statement. Its core objectives include promoting balanced development and fostering economic integration among member states of the West African Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU). BOAD prioritizes initiatives that address natural disadvantages and enhance economic cohesion within the region. Key missions involve mobilizing domestic funds for development, boosting the regional capital market, and attracting external investments. The bank's primary mission is to facilitate economic integration and balanced development across WAEMU countries—Benin, Burkina Faso, Côte d’Ivoire, Guinea-Bissau, Mali, Niger, Senegal, and Togo—by financing projects across various sectors to promote sustainable economic growth, job creation, and improved living conditions throughout West Africa.
